HOW CAN I MAKE A BOOKING ONLINE?
KnowledgeBases.SolutionText:
You can make your booking via our website:
  • Click on 'Search and Book' on the home page
  • Activate preferences on the left of the screen
  • Click on prices and promotions at your accommodation of choice
  • Give the holiday duration and the month of departure and
  • click on the appropriate option.
  • The price overview will appear and you can click on 'book this holiday now' to continue.

When you have filled this in you will see a price overview. After checking your booking overview you can accept, which will confirm the booking. You will then receive your booking number immediately. We would like to inform you that a booking made via the internet is a confirmed booking.

KnowledgeBases.DisplayText: ERV Travel insurance
Ski/snowboard rental
CAN I GIVE A PREFERENCE?
KnowledgeBases.SolutionText: Sunweb will do its best to fulfill any special wishes stated with the booking. Unfortunately we are dependent on service provider, such as the airlines and the accommodation providers. For this reason we cannot guarantee tajt all preferences will be met.

KnowledgeBases.DisplayText: HOW LONG IS A SELF DRIVE HOLIDAY?
KnowledgeBases.SolutionText: When traveling with your own transportation, you are allowed 7 nights stay. The holiday duration is 8 days and the arrival at your accommodation is on Saturday.

KnowledgeBases.DisplayText: HOW DO I PAY IF I BOOK VIA THE INTERNET?
KnowledgeBases.SolutionText: Whilst making an online booking you can state if you want to receive the invoice through regular or e-mail. You will receive the invoice and payment options within 4 working days via regular mail. Via e-mail you will receive the invoice with the payment terms and conditions within 1 working day. With this you can complete the payment.

KnowledgeBases.DisplayText: WHAT ARE THE PAYMENT OPTIONS?
KnowledgeBases.SolutionText:
We offer you the following payment options:

1. After booking pay directly online:
You can choose to pay via bank transfer online. This is a quick and easy way to make a payment. After receiving the booking number, you are able to make a direct transfer into our account. Our bank details can be found within the 'contact' section of sunweb.co.uk. Please remember when making a payment to quote your booking number as a payment reference.

After booking you will receive a confirmation with an access code for 'My Sunweb'. Here you can also check up on your payment status. As well as the details of your booked holiday.

2. Complete the payment yourself at a later time:
You can also choose to complete the payment yourself at a time of your convenience. For this the following rules are in effect:

Bookings made UP TO 6 WEEKS prior to departure:
You can make the full payment to our bank account with the use of internet banking. Please remember to state your booking number as reference!

If the invoice states that you can make a deposit then you can pay the total amount in two parts. Please stick to the amounts and the terms as stated on the invoice.

Bookings made WITHIN 6 WEEKS prior to departure:
If you book a holiday departing within 6 weeks we regard this as a last minute booking. The payment needs to be made immediately. Before we can send you your travel documents we need to have received the payment for the holiday.

The payment options:

Internet banking
With the use of internet banking you can transfer the payment to our bank account stating your booking number. Please note: for departures within one week you are required to make a speed payment transfer (only on work days!).

Payment from abroad
If you want to pay from abroad then you can transfer the outstanding payment to our bank account. You need the following details for this:

Bank: Lloyds TSB
Account number: 21109768
Bank Sort Code: 306541
BIC/SWIFT code: LLOYDGB21682
IBAN code: GB09 LOYD 3065 4121 1097 68

Stating: your booking number (if you do not have one yet then your name and address). Please note: For transfers from abroad we require a proof of payment/booking from your bank to be sent to our fax number.

We send a confirmation of your payment via email as soon as the payment has been processed by our payment team. In case you do not receive a confirmation your own bank receipt will figure as proof of payment. We therefore request you not to contact us with regard to a confirmation of payment!

With on time payments we will usually send/email you the travel documents 1 week prior to departure. In case you book a short time prior to departure we will send the travel documents as soon as possible.

KnowledgeBases.DisplayText: HOW MUCH IS THE DEPOSIT?
KnowledgeBases.SolutionText:
30% of the holiday price + travel insurance = deposit
The general deposit payment is 30% of the holiday price, and is due as soon as the invoice has been issued. The cost of the insurance also needs to be paid immediately. The remaining amount is to be paid to Sunweb Holidays 6 weeks prior to departure at the very latest. If you book a holiday with a departure date within 6 weeks time you need to pay the entire sum as soon as the invoice is received.

The standard deposit is increased to secure the airline tickets and these are non-refundable. As soon as you book package including flights, you will be required to pay 100% of the flight price. In addition to the cost of the flights and travel insurance; you will have pay 30% of the other package elements (accommodation and lift passes etc). This amount is due as soon as the invoice is received. The cost of the insurance also needs to be paid immediately. The remaining amount is to be paid to Sunweb Holidays 6 weeks prior to departure at the very latest. If you book a holiday with a departure date within 6 weeks time you need to pay the entire sum as soon as the invoice is received.

KnowledgeBases.DisplayText: CAN I CHANGE A BOOKING?
KnowledgeBases.SolutionText:
As a general rule, we can always add people to the booking, even after the invoice has been issued. In addition to adding more people, you can add other services such as ski hire. An updated invoice will be issued and you will be required to pay the additional charges. If you need to change the departure date, or reduce the number of paying passengers these changes will be dealt with as a partial cancellation, (for details please check 'Partial cancellation'). Please read the following conditions with regards to name changes for self-drive holidays:

  • The package has been booked on a self-drive basis
  • The new passenger meets all requirements, according to our agreement
  • The request was received 8 days prior to departure
  • The conditions of the service suppliers do not oppose against these changes
  • The party leader, the passenger who will be replaced and the replacement passenger are liable to Sunweb Holidays for the payment of the holiday price and all extra costs as a result of the replacement.

If you would like to change something in your booking, please email us at info@sunweb.co.uk
NOTE: Changes can only be made by the lead booker - 1st person on the booking

KnowledgeBases.DisplayText: Free ski rental equipment with flights packages to France
KnowledgeBases.SolutionText:
When you book a ski holiday with us including the flights, you will receive the Bronze ski equipment package for free. If you choose to upgrade the equipment rental, there will be a surcharge.

Other destinations such as Andorra, Austria,  Italy and Switzerland DO NOT have this option

KnowledgeBases.DisplayText: What is the Ski Guarantee?
What is the Ski Guarantee?
KnowledgeBases.SolutionText: If you book with Sunweb, you are promised a snow-filled break in the Alps. There is nothing more annoying than having a skiing holiday fall apart due to a lack of snow. Here at Sunweb, we understand this and will do everything that we can to move your holiday to another destination!

KnowledgeBases.DisplayText: Terms and Conditions
KnowledgeBases.SolutionText: Please click HERE for the Terms and Conditions of the Ski Guarantee.

KnowledgeBases.DisplayText: Arrival and Departure
KnowledgeBases.SolutionText:
On the day of arrival, you can usually only enter your accommodation after 5PM. On your day of departure you are expected to leave your apartment by 9AM. Late arrivals are very common in the French and Austrian Alps. The management of hotels and apartments are used to people arriving late, and always have a plan! It is however extremely important that you let them know in advance. You can make a request with Sunweb to add a note to your booking that you will be arriving late, BUT it is imperative that you also contact the accommodation directly. On your travel documents you will find contact information for the accommodation including a phone number. It is best to call the reception a few days before your arrival for instructions on how you can collect your keys.

PLEASE NOTE: This applies to both self drive and flight bookings.

KnowledgeBases.DisplayText: Hotel
Hotel
KnowledgeBases.SolutionText: For many Sunweb guests a hotel is the most pleasant accommodation option. Therefore we also offer a wide choice from a great number of hotels offering different quality and prices. The rooms we offer have private bathrooms; sometimes there are rooms with showers only or so called standard rooms where the shower and toilet are located in the corridor. It can occur that one accommodation offers different types of rooms (renovated/not renovated, old/new). Unless stated otherwise you may be allocated any of these rooms.

KnowledgeBases.DisplayText: Apartments
KnowledgeBases.SolutionText:
Since apartments and studios more or less look the same, we will give you a general description in this information. More detailed information can be found on the page of the accommodation in question. The descriptions for the accommodation in question can differ in reality and only figure as an example. Often the apartments and studios are privately owned by people who have decorated the interior to their own liking. A number of studios and apartments come equipped with a mezzanine, a semi-detached sleeping area. A cabin is a separate sleeping area without a window that can usually be sealed with a sliding door.

At maximum occupation the apartments and studios are often not ideal. The space is usually quite cramped for the maximum number of persons. The number of square meters in the description figure as a guideline. The actual surface area can differ from this. Please take into account for instance the warm water supply: there is often only one small boiler for everyone. The interior design is not what you are used to back home: in the French bathrooms it is usually not possible to hang up your shower head. There is also often a shower curtain missing. Appliances like coffee makers and cheese cutters are often not part of the kitchen.

If you are booking several studios or apartments at the same time then we will try to reserve them next to each other. This is at all times a preference! In practice this is not always possible.

Studios
A studio is always one living space with sleeping places for 2, 3, 4 or more people, depending on the size of the studio. There is a bathroom in every studio with a shower or bath and a toilet. Every studio also has a kitchenette consisting of an electric cooker, a fridge and in some cases a dishwasher. The studios usually have a balcony.

Apartments
An apartment is different than a studio because the living space always consists of at least two separate areas. Every apartment has a bedroom and living room functioning as a living and sleeping area. Please take into account that the living rooms aren't always equipped with an eating and sitting corner. In some cases only one of the two is present. If it is a six person apartment there is usually a bunk bed in the hall. An apartment with one bedroom and a living room is called a two room apartment. An apartment with two bedrooms and a living room is a three room apartment etc. In every apartment there is a bathroom with bath or shower present. Often there is a separate toilet (otherwise there is one in the bathroom). Every apartment has a kitchenette with an electrical cooker, a fridge and in some cases a dishwasher. The apartments usually have a balcony.

KnowledgeBases.DisplayText: Chalets
KnowledgeBases.SolutionText: If you would you like to stay together with family or a group of friends, then staying in a chalet is the perfect choice. Sunweb offers you the choice of a wide range of chalets of which some have an especially luxurious design. If you want to stay in a chalet we advise you to book early. Because from experience we know these accommodations to be very popular and they usually sell out fast. In the French winter sports destination of Les Menuires we offer a chalet on an all inclusive basis. This means that besides the accommodation also the meals (breakfast, lunch and dinner) and drinks are included. The Chalet manager takes care of the meals and the chalet but doesn't stay in the chalet himself.

KnowledgeBases.DisplayText: Facilities
KnowledgeBases.SolutionText: In the description of the different accommodations you will find a summary of the facilities. Please take into account that there is a small fee for the usage of certain facilities like the sauna and solarium. It is possible that some facilities like discotheques are closed outside of peak season due to a lack of interest. You can almost always hire a safe at the reception for your valuables and important documents. Sometimes you even have your own safe in your room/apartment. There is usually a fee attached to using the safe. If there is nothing mentioned about the costs in the description of an accommodation then it was not known at the time of publication whether or not guests have to pay for certain facilities. We strongly advise you to make use of the safe, because nothing is more annoying than losing important items during your holiday.

KnowledgeBases.DisplayText: Luggage room
KnowledgeBases.SolutionText: There is often the possibility to leave your luggage in the luggage room at your destination for a fee, so that you can store your luggage on the day of arrival and can still ski on the day of departure. The luggage room is always an extra service offered on location. The usage of the luggage room is always at the owner's risk and responsibility. Sunweb has no influence on the price or quality of the luggage room and any problems or complaints therefore cannot be dealt with by Sunweb.

KnowledgeBases.DisplayText: Pets
KnowledgeBases.SolutionText:
In the information about the accommodation you can find whether or not it is allowed and what the costs are. Click here for more information about bringing pets.


In case you are travelling with your own transportation, some accommodations allow you to bring your pet. Under details about the accommodation you can find out if this is allowed and what the costs are. Besides that, hardly any of our accommodation providers allow pets in the rooms or apartments. Sunweb charges 13,50 pounds administration fees per application for including your pet as carriage with the flight company. In addition, you need to pay a surcharge to the flight company for your pet. You pay this surcharge at the check in. N.B. You need to have an animal passport when transporting your dog or cat abroad.

KnowledgeBases.DisplayText: Do I have to clean tha accommodation or do I pay for this?
KnowledgeBases.SolutionText:
Naturally, hotel and pension rooms are kept clean on a daily basis. In apartments you are responsible for the cleaning yourself. These are guidelines however. At the end of your stay you need to thoroughly clean the apartment or studio before handing it over. If you fail to do so, an amount varying between £30 and your entire deposit will be held back. Some accommodations issue a fee for hygiene checks. This fee includes the use of cleaning liquids, vacuum cleaners and toilet paper. The costs of the final cleaning are often obligatory.

 

Some accommodations offer to clean the apartment for you for a fee. You will be able to find this on the accommodation page under the tab “Info/ Rooms/ Area”, under optional extras with additional costs.

KnowledgeBases.DisplayText: How can I cancel my holiday?
General cancellations
KnowledgeBases.SolutionText:
We can only deal with a cancellation if it has been reported in writing by the party leader. The cancellation can be sent by email: info@sunweb.co.uk with the word 'cancellation' as subject, followed by the booking number and the date of departure. If you booked a holiday with Sunweb, cancellation fees always apply. This also applies to bookings where the deposit is unpaid. At Sunweb, bookings are always confirmed.

Cancellations need to be made in writing, within 3 days after the event that caused the holiday to be cancelled (in part or full). Please take into account that there are always costs involved with cancellations. You are only entitled to a (partial) reimbursement of the holiday price if you have taken out an insurance policy and if the reason of cancellation is valid. Sunweb Holidays can only deal with a cancellation if it has been made in writing by the party leader. A fellow participant is not exclusively liable and therefore he or she cannot make a cancellation. In case a holiday is cancelled, the customer needs to pay the following cancellation costs besides possible reservation costs. The person who made the booking is responsible for paying this charge. The size of the charge depends on when we receive your notification - the more notice you give, the less we will be forced to charge.
These charges are based on the date you notify us of your cancellation. It relates to the number of days before departure. These charges are a percentage of the total cost of your booking, excluding the price of your insurance policy (if you have booked it with Sunweb/ERV). You may be able to claim for the cancellation charge from your travel insurance, please check your policy.

KnowledgeBases.DisplayText: Cacellation fees
KnowledgeBases.SolutionText:
• >55 days 30%*
  • 36-55 days 50%*
  • 22-35 days 70%*
  • 11-21 days 90%*
  • 0-10 days 100%*
* Your deposit is non-refundable, even if the cancellation charge calculated is lower than the deposit amount paid.

KnowledgeBases.DisplayText: Confirmation of cancellation
KnowledgeBases.SolutionText: You will receive a confirmation of the cancellation within one week. During busy periods this might take a little longer.

KnowledgeBases.DisplayText: When do I get my payment back?
KnowledgeBases.SolutionText:
As soon as you have filled in the accident report and sent this to the insurance company they will deal with your cancellation. Unfortunately we cannot say before hand how long this will take since this varies per cancellation. If the cancellation costs are lower than the total sum of the holiday, we will refund the overpaid amount to your bank account within 10 working days.

To process the payment and refund you the money, we do need your IBAN and BIC codes. For more information on IBAN and BIC codes, please click the following link:

http://www.barclays.co.uk/help/international/payments/making-and-receiving-international-payments/what-iban-swiftcode/

http://www.barclays.co.uk/help/international/payments/making-and-receiving-international-payments/swift-code/

KnowledgeBases.DisplayText: ERV Travel Insurance
KnowledgeBases.SolutionText:
ERV UK is the UK branch of Europäische Reiseversicherung A.G. Munich an ERGO Group company (www.ergo.com). ERV have appointed Emergency Medical Assistance providers who undergo rigorous testing and acceptance criteria to ensure their levels of service are not only met but exceeded. It can be a daunting experience if you are taken ill overseas. Should the unthinkable happen then you can be assured that their operators all speak English. Their personnel are all skilled, trained and are there to provide you with peace of mind.

Below are a few of the benefits of taking a policy with ERV.

PLEASE NOTE – this is a brief summary of the insurance policy ERV offers and for full details you should refer to https://www.erv.co.uk/sunweb-policy-documents.

KnowledgeBases.DisplayText: What is covered?
KnowledgeBases.SolutionText:
Missed departure:
This covers you for necessary hotel and travelling expenses incurred in reaching your booked destination. This is aimed at protecting you against unforeseeable traffic conditions, delayed public transport, or breakdowns and accidents.

Travel delay:
This covers you for both the added cost of having unavoidable delays as well as reclaiming costs should you decide to cancel your holiday due to these delays.

Personal Accident:
This section will cover you for serious accidents. These are judged 12 months after the date of the accident, and is aimed at providing cover for death, loss of limb, permanent disability and permanent loss of sight.

Medical Emergency Expenses:
The cover will include costs for medical and surgical treatment, additional travel expenses, for you and an immediate relative or friend. Also in the case of death this section provides cover for conveyance of the body or ashes to the UK or local funeral expenses.

Medical Inconvenience Benefit:
This covers you for additional expenses while being submitted to a registered hospital abroad.

Personal Property:
You are covered for up to £1,500 for the value of your own personal baggage which is lost, stolen, damaged or destroyed. Up to £500 for lost money, also up to £100 for the cost of replacing required necessities if your own baggage is delayed.

Loss of passport or driving licence expenses:
Up to £250 for reasonable additional travel or accommodation expenses you incur abroad in obtaining a new passport/driving licence if lost or stolen.

Personal Public liability:
This will cover you up to a maximum of £1,000,000 for your legal expenses and legal liability for damages which were caused by an accident that happened during the trip, leading to a claim being made against you.

Winter Sports:
This section offers cover specifically aimed at costs that you may incur or wish to claim back during a winter sports holiday. These include:
-Ski equipment
-Ski hire
-Ski pack (lift passes)
-Piste closure
-Avalanche closure

KnowledgeBases.DisplayText: Cancellation
KnowledgeBases.SolutionText:
You are covered up to the amount purchased if your travel and accommodation arrangements are cancelled before your departure from the United Kingdom, providing the cancellation is necessary and unavoidable.
Necessary and unavoidable reasons for cancellation include the death or disablement by bodily injury, illness, pregnancy or being subject to quarantine of you, any person you are intending to travel or stay with, an immediate relative of yours or of any person you are intending to travel with or a close business associate of yours.
There are further suitable reasons for cancellation and exclusions you can find in the full terms of the policy.

KnowledgeBases.DisplayText: Important conditions
KnowledgeBases.SolutionText:
Pre-existing Medical Conditions: this policy will not cover any claim relating directly or indirectly to a pre-existing medical condition. This is defined as any past, current or recurring serious medical condition which has been diagnosed, investigated or treated at any time prior to travel, even if this condition is considered to be stable and under control.

There are a number of important conditions that you must be aware of before making a claim. Some of the main conditions include:
* You must take all reasonable steps to recover any lost or stolen articles.
* You must obtain any medical certificates, information, evidence and receipts required in order to make a successful claim.
* If at the time of making a claim there is any other policy covering the same risk we are entitled to contact that insurer for a contribution.

Please note that this is a summary of some of the conditions, and for full details you should refer to https://www.erv.co.uk/sunweb-policy-documents

KnowledgeBases.DisplayText: Making a claim
KnowledgeBases.SolutionText:
First thing you need to do is download a claims form. This form can also be downloaded from www.erv.co.uk/claims. Your policy number will be the same as your booking number.

Complete the form, sign it and send it to ERV. It is important to ensure all the information is factual and accurate before sending off the form. You should also give as much detail as possible to help ERV handle your claim.

You should ensure you attach all original receipts, guarantees, statements and any other proof you have.

You can also contact ERV:
Assistance Helpline: +44 (0) 1444 476 000
ERV Claims Service Tel: +44 (0) 1403 788 515

KnowledgeBases.DisplayText: Prices per person
KnowledgeBases.SolutionText: The listed prices are per person. Our prices fluctuate during the season. Sunweb Holidays works with fluctuating prices based on the dynamics of supply and demand. This means that the price of packages can change each day due to changes from suppliers and airlines. To see the most updated prices, please check our website. In the case that changes occur in the mentioned components, Sunweb reserves the right to calculate these costs into the total price.

KnowledgeBases.DisplayText: What are the advantages of hiring Sunweb equipment in advance?
KnowledgeBases.SolutionText:
Hiring ski and/or snowboard equipment offers you several advantages:

  •  Always the newest equipment;
  • No maintenance costs;
  • No hassle with carrying;
  • No value depreciation of your own equipment.

KnowledgeBases.DisplayText: On what day is the lift pass activated?
KnowledgeBases.SolutionText: The lift pass is usually activated the day after arrival. A seventh day lift pass (last Saturday) can often be booked extra; the price mentioned for this is only valid with your booking in your home country; on location you usually pay more.

KnowledgeBases.DisplayText: Strict control
KnowledgeBases.SolutionText:
It is prohibited to travel with an expired passport. The first names and surnames on the ticket need to be the same as the names in the passports. On the ticket of engaged travelers only the (maiden) name should be stated in the passport. If the names do not correspond you can be denied to board a flight. If you are not a British national, you are required to inform the embassy of your destination country if you need a visa. Children are always required to have their own passport, regardless of age. Being in the possession of the right travel documents is your own responsibility at all times.

Attention:
The inspection of travel documents has become more strict. This means that passports with scratches, tears or other damaging will not be accepted. So make sure to check your passport thoroughly prior to departure! Travelling with the right documents is your own responsibility and Sunweb Holidays cannot be held responsible for a possible flight restriction and the accompanied costs.

KnowledgeBases.DisplayText: Self Drive
What do I need to do if I arrive at the destination in the evening?
KnowledgeBases.SolutionText: If you expect to arrive at your accommodation after 6 PM you are obliged to inform the reception of the accommodation about this to ensure that your room will be available. The telephone number of your accommodation can be found on the voucher. Sunweb cannot be held accountable if your accommodation is not available immediately, not even in the case that you have stated with your booking that you will be arriving late.

KnowledgeBases.DisplayText: When do my ski and snowboard lessons start?
KnowledgeBases.SolutionText: In nearly all cases the lessons start on Sunday. The lessons in Superdévoluy and La Joue du Loup always start on Monday.

KnowledgeBases.DisplayText: Are flights included?
KnowledgeBases.SolutionText: Sunweb offers flight packages to a wide range of different resorts. If flights are bookable you will be able to select the plane logo in the Prices and Booking tab. All of our flights are booked through our partner EasyJet.

KnowledgeBases.DisplayText: Are transfers included?
KnowledgeBases.SolutionText:
Flights packages
Sunweb includes return airport transfers for all flight bookings. Information about your transfer will be sent you with your travel documents ten days before your departure date. All transfers are shared.
NOTE: Unfortunately, we cannot offer a transfer if the booking with flights is made within 8 days before departure.


Self drive 
It is not possible for Sunweb to offer transfers for self drive packages.

KnowledgeBases.DisplayText: Are there reps/ guides at the destination?
KnowledgeBases.SolutionText: Most of the resorts that we offer have a holiday Rep/ guide in the resort itself or in one of the willages nearby. This information will be provided to you when you receive your tickets. Names and phone numbers of the reps/ guides will be provided in the vouchers as well.

KnowledgeBases.DisplayText: Tickets / Vouchers
When will I receive the tickets / vouchers?
KnowledgeBases.SolutionText:
Your tickets and vouchers will be sent to you about 10 days before departure, as long as the payment has been received in full. If you have given us your email address you will receive the tickets via email. If you do not have an email address you will receive the tickets by regular post. You can also state with your booking whether you want to receive the tickets by post or email. If you wish us to send the tickets by regular post we charge £15 postage fees.

These vouchers will contain all the information that you will need during your holiday. It is important to print these out and take them with you. If you make a change to the booking after you have received the first version of the vouchers, you will get an updated version. You will have to PRINT the most up to date version and take these with you.

This is a quick list of some of the most important things that will be listed on the vouchers:
  1. All addresses: hotels, apartments, restaurants for half board, lift pass offices, ski hire shops and ski schools.
  2. Phone numbers: You will get the number of the hotel/apartment so you can arrange your late arrival (if applicable).
  3. Rep info: some resorts have reps. Names and contact info will be printed on the vouchers.
  4. General travel info

KnowledgeBases.DisplayText: How can I sign up or cancel my subscription for the Sunweb winter sports newsletter?
KnowledgeBases.SolutionText:
To subscribe to the newsletter, simply go to the bottom of the webpage. Under the header "Ski Holiday Newsletter" you can leave your email address and click on "subscribe".

To unsubscribe, you can open one of the newsletters that was sent to you and click on "unsubscribe" at the bottom of the email. You will then be opted out.

KnowledgeBases.DisplayText: Where can I find a promotion code?
KnowledgeBases.SolutionText: You can fill in the promotion code in step 3 of your booking form. You will then get your new total price by pressing the button "recalculate price" After that you can continue completing your booking. If the discount does not appear in the price calculation or if you get an error report then you can mention the promotion code in the remarks in step 3. If the promotion code is still valid you will receive an amended invoice including the discount within three days.

KnowledgeBases.DisplayText: How can I log in to " My Sunweb"
KnowledgeBases.SolutionText:
To log in to the "My Sunweb" Page, please fill out your email address and password.

If this is the first time that you are loggin in to the "My Sunweb" page, then please press "Forgot your password". The system will send an email to the email address that you have provided. The link in the email will allow you to reset the password.

KnowledgeBases.DisplayText: What is My Sunweb?
KnowledgeBases.SolutionText: In the 'My Sunweb' portal you can review all kinds of information about your booking, like the status of your payment and the preliminary flight times (if known). It is also an easy way to read about your destination and accommodation and to settle payments. We have also made a list of interesting links for you! Go to 'My Sunweb'.

KnowledgeBases.DisplayText: Unsatisfied at the destination?
KnowledgeBases.SolutionText: If you have complaints about the holiday or if you are not satisfied with your accommodation then you should report this to the reception of your accommodation, immediately. It is also important to contact the Sunweb Guide on destination, if there is one. Please check your travel documents for his or her contact information. If nobody is available or if you think the complaint has not been dealt with appropriately then you should call our emergency number. If the problem occurs during Sunweb’s opening hours, you can call the UK office. It is important to contact us while you are still on holiday, via phone or email. Our contact details are on your 14 travel documents. This procedure is absolutely necessary because once you have made your complaint Sunweb can often help straight away to deal with the complaint.

KnowledgeBases.DisplayText: Lost and Found
KnowledgeBases.SolutionText: Sunweb Holiday cannot be held responsible for missing luggage. If you have forgotten something important in your accommodation you can notify Sunweb Holiday’s office. You can send an email with a description of the items that you have forgotten to: customercare@sunweb.co.uk.   You can do this up to one week after arriving back home. All the enquiries submitted after this first week back home, will not be dealt with.

KnowledgeBases.DisplayText: What can I expect when I make a reservation?
What can I expect when I make a reservation?
KnowledgeBases.SolutionText:
A holiday abroad means different people, a different culture, different food etc. This is one of the appealing aspects of such a holiday, but also an aspect to be taken into account with regard to your holiday expectations.
 
  • If you choose a basic accommodation then you should not expect the comfort and facilities of a luxurious four or five star hotel.
  • You should take into account possible construction or other service activities at the destination, such as snow shovelling or the preparation of pistes and roads.
  • Take into account that there are limited opening times for shops, ski lifts and entertainment options and an even more limited number of facilities to use outside of peak season.
  • In some bathrooms there might not be a shower curtain and/or a stand to hang up the shower head.

KnowledgeBases.DisplayText: ATOL
KnowledgeBases.SolutionText:
All the flight-inclusive holidays on this website are financially protected by the ATOL scheme. When you pay you will be supplied with an ATOL Certificate. Please ask for it and check to ensure that everything you booked (flights, hotels and other services) is listed on it. Please see our booking conditions for further information or for more information about financial protection and the ATOL Certificate go to: www.atol.org.uk/ATOLCertificate
Sunweb/ Sundio Group’s ATOL number is 11092.

We, Sundio Group International GmbH, will provide you with the services listed on the ATOL Certificate (or a suitable alternative). In some cases, where neither we nor the supplier are able to do so for reasons of insolvency, an alternative ATOL holder may provide you with the services you have bought or a suitable alternative (at no extra cost to you). You agree to accept that in those circumstances the alternative ATOL holder will perform those obligations and you agree to pay any money outstanding to be paid by you under your contract to that alternative ATOL holder. However, you also agree that in some cases it will not be possible to appoint an alternative ATOL holder, in which case you will be entitled to make a claim under the ATOL scheme (or your credit card issuer where applicable).
 
If we, Sundio Group International GmbH, are unable to provide the services listed (or a suitable alternative, through an alternative ATOL holder or otherwise) for reasons of insolvency, the Trustees of the Air Travel Trust may make a payment to (or confer a benefit on) you under the ATOL scheme. You agree that in return for such a payment or benefit you assign absolutely to those Trustees any claims which you have or may have arising out of or relating to the non-provision of the services, including any claim against us, the travel agent 15 (or your credit card issuer where applicable). You also agree that any such claims may be re-assigned to another body, if that other body has paid sums you have claimed under the ATOL scheme.

KnowledgeBases.DisplayText: Filing a complaint after your holiday
KnowledgeBases.SolutionText:
Complaints that have not been reported at the destination will not be dealt with in the UK. If your complaint has not been dealt with to your satisfaction then it is necessary to fill in a complaint form so that you can issue your complaint back home. You can report your complaint accompanied with a motivation in writing, via e-mail at the latest within one month after the holiday has ended. Sending the complaint without any further explanation will not suffice to have your complaint dealt with. The complaint can be sent to: customercare@sunweb.co.uk

We are a Member of ABTA, membership number Y3497. We are obliged to maintain a high standard of service to you by ABTA’s Code of Conduct. We can also offer you ABTA’s scheme for the resolution of disputes which is approved by the Chartered Trading Standards Institute. If we can’t resolve your complaint, go to www.abta.com to use ABTA’s simple procedure. Further information on the Code and ABTA’s assistance in resolving disputes can be found on www.abta.com. You can also access the European Commission Online Dispute (ODR) Resolution platform at http://ec.europa.eu/consumers/odr/. This ODR platform is a means of registering your complaint with us; it will not determine how your complaint should be resolved.

KnowledgeBases.DisplayText: Can I use multiple promotion codes for one booking?
KnowledgeBases.SolutionText: No, unfortunately this is not possible. For each booking only one promotion code can be processed. This is because the discount is not valid in combination with other promotions.

KnowledgeBases.DisplayText: When is the Newsletter sent out?
KnowledgeBases.SolutionText: The newsletter is usually sent on Thursdays. Unfortunately we cannot say at what time this will be because this changes every week. There is no use in contacting us by telephone since our staff does not know exactly what time of day the newsletter will be sent out either.

KnowledgeBases.DisplayText: Passport
How much snow is there at the destination?
KnowledgeBases.SolutionText:
You can find this out in the following way:

  • Click on the accommodation of your choice
  • Click on the tab 'destination' and then on 'ski area'.
  • Here you can find the present weather conditions.

KnowledgeBases.DisplayText: Which airports does Sunweb use?
KnowledgeBases.SolutionText: Sunweb flies from a number of different airports in the UK you can select which airport you would like to fly from in the Prices and Booking tab. The destination airport that you will fly to depends on which resort you are staying at.

KnowledgeBases.DisplayText: At what time do the ski and snowboard lessons take place?
KnowledgeBases.SolutionText:
Sunweb has special agreements with the ski schools, so you will be required to comply with the times we have already agreed upon with the ski school. It is always possible to give your preference to either morning or afternoon lessons, however, we cannot guarantuee the preference.

If you would specifically like to have lessons either in the morning or in the afternoon, we advise to book directly with the ski schiool.

KnowledgeBases.DisplayText: Am I obliged to bring a safety reflector jacket?
KnowledgeBases.SolutionText: The European Commission advises you to wear a safety reflector jacket in the event of a break down in Italy and Austria. These jackets are obligatory for residents but local police officers will sometimes fine tourists as well. The jackets are light weight and easy to store. Not having one in your car could lead to a fine as well!

KnowledgeBases.DisplayText: How much is the lift pass for a 7th day or the extended area?
KnowledgeBases.SolutionText:
This depends on the destination:

  • Choose your accommodation;
  • Click on the tab 'Lift passes/ Skis & Classes'
  • and then on ‘Lift Pass’ for more information.

 If you intend to use the extended ski area for a few days then you can apply for an extended lift pass for your entire stay directly with your booking. This will often work out cheaper for you instead of adding a few days extension to your lift pass on location.

KnowledgeBases.DisplayText: What kind of equipment can I hire through Sunweb?
KnowledgeBases.SolutionText:
You can specify that you would like to include ski or snowboard hire directly when booking. If you want to add ski material to your booking, you can do this up to 72 hours before departure (if your holiday starts on a Saturday). The following types of material can be booked:

Bronze

This material is ideal for beginners and intermediate skiers and snowboarders. This material is particularly agile, so it makes turning and breaking easy. Parallel skiing is also possible with these skis.

Silver

This is ideal material for intermediate skiers and snowboarders. The material is agile, but also suitable to cut corners sharp. Even at high speeds these skis provide great performance.

Gold

These skis and snowboards are made of high quality material, and are perfect for experienced skiers. This comfortable material is suitable on all track types and snow conditions. 

Diamond

These are high performance skis and snowboards with the latest technology, and are suitable for the most experienced skiers.

 

TIP: Tell our rental partner your exact requirements (eg off piste skiing) so they can help you select the right material.

NOTE: A helmet is not included in this package. You can choose to bring your own, or rent one locally if available.

KnowledgeBases.DisplayText: Is a children's discount valid in combination with a third bed discount?
KnowledgeBases.SolutionText: Children's discount and a third bed discount are not valid in combination. In the case that there are several possible discounts the highest discount will always be given.

KnowledgeBases.DisplayText: Insurance
KnowledgeBases.SolutionText: Choosing your insurance policy is an extremely important part of planning your holiday. We strongly advise all passengers to take out insurance to cover costs that arise from unexpected events such as an injury, or stolen belongings. We have teamed up with ERV to offer a Winter Sports policy for Sunweb Customers.

KnowledgeBases.DisplayText: Cancellations if a flight is included in the package
KnowledgeBases.SolutionText:
All scheduled flights are non-refundable. This means that you will not be refunded the amount you have paid for the flights (which form part of your package). This means that you will have to pay 100% of the flight price as well as the percentage of the remaining components of your package. This percentage will be calculated based on the table above. You may be able to claim for the cancellation charge from your travel insurance, please check your policy.
*Where the standard deposit is increased to secure specific facilities or an additional payment has been made for transport airline tickets and these are non-refundable, then the scale of charges shown will be calculated based on a % of the cost of all other arrangements and the non-refundable charges will be added to that cancellation charge to give the total charge. Infant charges of £45 and any insurance premium paid are non-refundable in the event of the cancellation of a holiday.

KnowledgeBases.DisplayText: What are the costs if I have to make a cancellation?
Is there a Television?
KnowledgeBases.SolutionText: In many accommodations there is the possibility to hire a television. Sometimes the television is already present and often this is free of charge. The choice of channels offered is down to the controller of the receiving system and we can not be held accountable for the chosen channels or their quality.

KnowledgeBases.DisplayText: What time can I occupy the hotel room?
KnowledgeBases.SolutionText: Hotel rooms are usually ready around 4pm on the day of arrival. You are expected to check out of the rooms by 9am on the day of departure.

KnowledgeBases.DisplayText: What is the risk of taking my pet?
KnowledgeBases.SolutionText: The transportation of your pet is at your own risk. It is only possible to bring pets older than 3 months. In case there is no passport for the accompanying animals, or if there is no tattoo or electronic identification device, the animal will not be allowed on the flight. For more information about import regulations for a pet you can contact the embassy of your destination country.

KnowledgeBases.DisplayText: At what time can I occupy the apartment?
KnowledgeBases.SolutionText: On the day of arrival, you can usually only enter your accommodation after 5PM. On your day of departure you are expected to leave your apartment by 9AM. Late arrivals are very common in the French and Austrian Alps. The management of hotels and apartments are used to people arriving late, and always have a plan! It is however extremely important that you let them know in advance. You can make a request with Sunweb to add a note to your booking that you will be arriving late, BUT it is imperative that you also contact the accommodation directly. On your travel documents you will find contact information for the accommodation including a phone number. It is best to call the reception a few days before your arrival for instructions on how you can collect your keys. PLEASE NOTE: This applies to both self drive and flight bookings.

KnowledgeBases.DisplayText: At what time can I occupy the chalet?
KnowledgeBases.SolutionText: On the day of arrival, you can usually only enter your accommodation after 5PM. On your day of departure you are expected to leave your apartment by 9AM. Late arrivals are very common in the French and Austrian Alps. The management of hotels and apartments are used to people arriving late, and always have a plan! It is however extremely important that you let them know in advance. You can make a request with Sunweb to add a note to your booking that you will be arriving late, BUT it is imperative that you also contact the accommodation directly. On your travel documents you will find contact information for the accommodation including a phone number. It is best to call the reception a few days before your arrival for instructions on how you can collect your keys. PLEASE NOTE: This applies to both self drive and flight bookings.

KnowledgeBases.DisplayText: Lockers
KnowledgeBases.SolutionText: You can almost always hire a locker at the reception for you valuables and important documents. This can also be one main locker. Sometimes you can use your own locker in your room/apartment. Usually there is a fee attached to using the lockers.

CAN I CHANGE A FIRST NAME OR DATE OF BIRTH?
KnowledgeBases.SolutionText: For most changes up to 8 days before departure we can change the details of the passengers. You can either email the changes to us at info@sunweb.co.uk or call us. Changes can only be made by the lead booker - the 1st person on the booking. We will send you an amended invoice as soon as the booking has been amended.

KnowledgeBases.DisplayText: WHEN AM I SUPPOSED TO MAKE A DEPOSIT?
KnowledgeBases.SolutionText: The deposit needs to be made within ten days of Sunweb Holidays sending the invoice. The costs of the travel insurance need to be covered as well. You can find the exact amount of the deposit for your booking on the first page of the invoice. The remaining amount needs to be received by us no later than six weeks prior to departure. If you have stated an email address you will receive a confirmation of your payment after the payment has been processed.

KnowledgeBases.DisplayText: HOW LONG IS THE PROCESSING TIME FOR THE PAYMENT?
KnowledgeBases.SolutionText:
You will receive a confirmation of receipt automatically via email as soon as we have processed the payment. How long does this take (processing time)? This is dependent on the method of payment:

  •  Internet banking: this takes 3 working days on average
  • Regular transfer: this takes 6 working days

KnowledgeBases.DisplayText: CAN I BOOK A HOLIDAY FOR TWO WEEKS?
KnowledgeBases.SolutionText: It is possible to book a holiday for 14 days. If you want to book a holiday to your destination for two weeks you need to contact our office about this.

KnowledgeBases.DisplayText: I HAVE A SPECIAL DIET, CAN YOU INFORM THE STAFF ON LOCATION?
KnowledgeBases.SolutionText: In case you have a special diet we can notify the accommodation in question of your preference. Please take into account that the more basic hotels might not always be able fulfil a request. A vegetarian diet often means that you don't eat meat on location. Meat substitutes as we know from back home are often unavailable. Sunweb cannot take responsibility for, nor guarantee, any special diet requests that have been made.

If you have already booked your holiday, please contact us on 0203 170 8206.

We always do our best to meet your requirements but some things are out of our control - we'll endeavour to sort something out for you and let you know either way. If your request is essential to your holiday arrangements, please let us know at the time of booking.

KnowledgeBases.DisplayText: How to apply for the Ski Guarantee

You will need to fill in the form. It will be sent to the Sunweb Team automatically. Please complete our ski guarantee form.

KnowledgeBases.DisplayText: Accommodation types
Pets
Chalets
What is the difference between a studio and an apartment?
KnowledgeBases.SolutionText:
A studio is always one living space with sleeping places for 2, 3, 4 or more people, depending on the size of the studio. There is a bathroom in every studio with a shower or bath and a toilet. Every studio also has a kitchenette consisting of an electric cooker, a fridge and in some cases a dishwasher. The studios usually have a balcony.

 

An apartment is different than a studio because the living space always consists of at least two separate areas. Every apartment has a bedroom and living room functioning as a living and sleeping area. If it is a six person apartment there is usually a bunk bed in the hall. An apartment with one bedroom and a living room is called a two room apartment. An apartment with two bedrooms and a living room is a three room apartment, etc. In every apartment there is a bathroom with bath or shower present. Often there is a separate toilet (otherwise there is one the bathroom). Every apartment has a kitchenette with an electrical cooker, a fridge and in some cases a dishwasher. The apartments usually have a balcony.

KnowledgeBases.DisplayText: How do I register my pet?
KnowledgeBases.SolutionText:
Sunweb Holidays is obliged to report a pet to the airline company.
The necessary details for the application are:
  • Weight of the animal
  • Size of the kennel (if necessary)
  • Your booking nummer
Checking in
You need to have a passport for accompanying pets. This passport has to contain details about rabies vaccinations and other obligatory details about the health status of the animals. In addition, the passport has to contain sections for clinical research and legalisation. Cats and dogs also have to carry either a clearly legible tattoo or an electronic identification device (transponder).

KnowledgeBases.DisplayText: Which type of rooms are in my accommodation?
KnowledgeBases.SolutionText: You can find more information about the different type of rooms at the accommodation under the header 'accommodation' and then under the header 'room types'.

KnowledgeBases.DisplayText: How much is the Tourist tax?
KnowledgeBases.SolutionText: At most of the accommodations you need to pay a small fee as tourist tax upon arrival on location. Please refer to the facilities section of the accommodation page/s for more info about tourist tax. In some cases, tourist tax is included but general you will have to pay this on the spot. Tourist tax is normally in Euros and is per person, per night. These fees might change during the winter season.

KnowledgeBases.DisplayText: Free Skis with flights packages to France
What is covered?
Will I get a confirmation of my cancellation?
Can I cancel a meal plan to get a price reduction?
KnowledgeBases.SolutionText: If an accommodation offers a standard inclusive arrangement it is not possible to cancel the meal plan for a reduction in price.

KnowledgeBases.DisplayText: What are the terms and conditions for equipment hire?
KnowledgeBases.SolutionText:
For all winter sports countries the following standard terms and conditions are in effect with regard to equipment hire:

- If your shoe size is larger than size 10 we cannot guarantee that the right size boots are available on location and we therefore advise you to hire your boots in the UK.

- on location you can take out a special insurance policy to cover theft and damage of the hired equipment (ask on location for precise terms and conditions).

KnowledgeBases.DisplayText: Where can I find the costs for the lift pass?
KnowledgeBases.SolutionText:
At many of our destinations the lift pass is included in the total price. You can find this at the bottom of the price table reached via the prices and promotions at the accommodation of your choice.

If the lift pass is not included you can find the costs of the lift pass at your accommodation:

  • Choose your accommodation
  • click on the tab ''Lift passes/ Skis & Classes' '
  • and then on 'lift pass ' for more information.

If this states 'direct add to booking' then you can book it with us in advance. If it states 'about' before the prices then these prices are indicative and you can only reserve on location.

KnowledgeBases.DisplayText: Do I have to bring snow chains?
KnowledgeBases.SolutionText: Snow chains are obligatory in the Alps. Please inform yourself well in advance abut driving to the winter sports destination and leave home well prepared.

KnowledgeBases.DisplayText: Can I reserve my lessons for mor-less days or number of hours?
KnowledgeBases.SolutionText: You can only reserve the stated number of days and hours with your booking. If you require other options then you should book this with the ski school yourself on location.

KnowledgeBases.DisplayText: Is luggage included?
KnowledgeBases.SolutionText: Hold luggage and ski equipment as luggage are not included with your flight tickets. These can be added in Step 2 of the booking process for an additional cost. The cost of luggage is dictated by EasyJet, and therefore can vary with each flight. All flights include ONE cabin bag per person (maximum size of 56 x 45 x 25cm; including handles and wheels). There is no weight restriction for the hand luggage. The weight limit for hold luggage and ski luggage is 20KG. For more information see here.

KnowledgeBases.DisplayText: Where can I pick up my ski / snowboard equipment?
KnowledgeBases.SolutionText: We work with different equipment providers per destination. You will find the address details of the relevant provider stated on the travel document that you will receive at the latest one week prior to departure.

KnowledgeBases.DisplayText: How can I cange my email address for the newsletter?
KnowledgeBases.SolutionText: You can unsubscribe from the newsletter with your old email address and sign up with the new email address again.

KnowledgeBases.DisplayText: Is the promotion code valid per person or per booking?
KnowledgeBases.SolutionText: The promotion code is valid per booking and not per person. If several participants have received a promotion code only one code can be used per booking.

KnowledgeBases.DisplayText: Have you forgotten your password?
KnowledgeBases.SolutionText: Go to "My Sunweb' on our website and click on 'forget password'. You will then receive a new password via email.

KnowledgeBases.DisplayText: Do I have to pay a deposit for the chalet?
KnowledgeBases.SolutionText:
For chalets chalets there is usually a deposit required. You will get this back when you depart as long as the state of your accommodation is approved. In some cases the deposit will be sent to your home afterwards through the post. The deposit sum and the payment details are always listed in the details of the accommodation in question.

Dealing with deposits is always between you and the accommodation provider. Sunweb has no influence on this and can therefore not be held accountable for conflicting opinions regarding the deposit between you and the accommodation provider.

KnowledgeBases.DisplayText: General Sunweb Information
KnowledgeBases.SolutionText: http://ski.sunweb.co.uk/travelinfo/insurance.htm

KnowledgeBases.DisplayText: What should I do if I get an error when entering the promotion code?
KnowledgeBases.SolutionText: If the discount does not appear in the price calculation or you receive an error message, you can mention the promotion code in the comments in step three of the booking form. If the promotion code is still valid you will receive an amended invoice including the discount within three days. Please note: If a promotion code consists of a stripe then this is always an underscore (Press shift and the minus symbol).

KnowledgeBases.DisplayText: Where can I collect my lift pass?
KnowledgeBases.SolutionText:
In most cases, the lift passes will be collected by the rep / guides at the resort a couple of days before you arrive at your destination. The Reps and guides will make sure that you will receive them on the day of your arrival. In some cases, when there is no rep/ guide at the resort, you will be able to pick your lift passes up at the ski lift station.

Please note: You will be able to find this information on the vouchers, which you will receive approximately 10 days before departure.

KnowledgeBases.DisplayText: Are airport transfers included?
KnowledgeBases.SolutionText: Airport transfers are always automatically included in a flights package, unless the booking is made within 8 days before departure. Please check your invoice carefully to see if transfers are included.

KnowledgeBases.DisplayText: Where can I find the costs for lessons?
KnowledgeBases.SolutionText:
You can find this information at the ski area of your choice:

  • Choose your accommodation
  • click on the tab 'Lift passes/ Skis & Classes' and then on
  • 'Lessons’ for more information.

 

If the abbreviation 'about' precedes the price then these are indicative prices and you can only reserve on location.

KnowledgeBases.DisplayText: Is the departure date the same as the day of arrival?
KnowledgeBases.SolutionText: Yes, in the case of pricate transportation our website states the departure date as the day of arrival.

KnowledgeBases.DisplayText: Where can I find discounts and surcharges for the lift pass?
KnowledgeBases.SolutionText:
You can find this at the destination of your choice:

  • Choose your accommodation
  • click on the tab ''Lift passes/ Skis & Classes' '
  • and then on 'lift pass ‘ for more information.

KnowledgeBases.DisplayText: Is it cheaper to book equipment through Sunweb in advance?
KnowledgeBases.SolutionText: It is usually cheaper to hire equipment with us instead of on location. Especially in France the local rates are considerably higher than the prices we charge for equipment hire.

KnowledgeBases.DisplayText: Do prices include a lift pass?
KnowledgeBases.SolutionText: For most destinations and accommodations the lift pass is already included in the price. You can always find this clearly stated in the "prices and offers"of the accommodation question.

KnowledgeBases.DisplayText: Cancellations
When do I get my payment back?
What do room types consist of?
KnowledgeBases.SolutionText: For an explanation about the room types please go to the accommodation in question. In the tab 'Accommodation' under facilities you will find an explanation of the room types.

KnowledgeBases.DisplayText: What preperations do I need to make to take my pet?
KnowledgeBases.SolutionText:
Tips for bringing pets:

  • Issues like vaccinations and travel documents should be organised well in advance
  • Attach a label with the name of your pet and, if needed, feeding instructions to the side of the kennel.
  • Do not give your pet anything to drink 4 hours prior to departure.
  • Animals can suffer from flight sickness. So do not feed them within 12 hours prior to departure.
  • Anaesthetizing pets before travelling is strongly advised against. This will cause the animal to adjust slower to its new surroundings and possible cool down during the flight.
